Wisdom: لَنْ يَصْدُقَ الْخَبَرُ حَتَّى يَتَحَقَّقَ الْعِيَانُ
enWisdom: Reports will never be accepted as true until [they are] verified by the eyes
Seeing something [yourself] is not the same as being informed about it

Wisdom: لَا تُخْبِرْ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِ عِلْماً
enWisdom: Do not relate that which you have no knowledge about

Wisdom: لَا تُحَدِّثِ النَّاسَ بِكُلِّ مَا تَسْمَعُ فَكَفَى بِذَلِكَ خُرْقاً [حُمْقاً]
enWisdom: Do not relate to the people all that you hear, for this suffices as silliness (or foolishness)

Wisdom: لَا تَقُلْ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُ فَتُتَّهَمَ بِإِخْبَارِكَ بِمَا تَعْلَمُ
enWisdom: Do not say that which you do not know, thereby making others suspicious of your statements about what you do know

Wisdom: لَا تُخْبِرَنَّ إِلَّا عَنْ ثِقَةٍ فَتَكُونَ كَذَّاباً وَإِنْ أَخْبَرْتَ عَنْ غَيْرِهِ فَإِنَّ الْكَذِبَ مَهَانَةٌ وَذُلٌّ
enWisdom: Never transmit information except from a reliable person otherwise you will become a liar, and if you transmit from other than him then surely telling lies is [a cause of] disgrace and dishonour

Wisdom: لَا خَيْرَ فِي الْمَنْظَرِ إِلَّا مَعَ حُسْنِ الْمَخْبَرِ
enWisdom: There is no good in that which is viewed except when accompanied with a good source of information [or good elocution]
